articles.title: Research Methods and Skills
articles.description: Data manipulation, research methods, and statistics in Psychology
articles.contents:
This is the homepage for the R-based sections of the University of Lincolnâ€™s MSc programmes in Developmental Psychology, Research Methods in Psychology, and Forensic Psychology.
Module co-ordinator: Matt Craddock
Semester A - PSY9251M/PSY9219M
Research Methods in Psychology/Research Methods and Skills
Staff:
Matt Craddock
Tochukwu Onwuegbusi
Ava Horowitz
Patrick Hylton
Semester B - PSY9250M/PSY9003
Advanced Research Methods in Psychology/Advanced Research Methods and Skills
Staff:
Matt Craddock
Tochukwu Onwuegbusi
Michael Mireku
Getting set up for the course
For students enrolled on this course, you should generally use RStudio.cloud. Weekly exercises will be distributed as projects to be copied on the cloud through the course workspace.
To run any of the materials locally on your own machine, you will need the following:
A recent version of R, download from here.
A recent version of RStudio, download from here
